hook.text: The person who talks the most in a meeting usually has the least power. Real power listens.

buildup.text: Body language, seating positions, and speaking patterns all reveal the true power structure in any room.

discovery.text: Watch who others look at before speaking. That's the real decision-maker, regardless of titles.

twist.text: The quiet person in the corner may hold the final authority. Don't pitch to the loudest voice.

climax.text: Identify the real decision-maker early. Direct your best arguments where they'll actually matter.

punchline.text: Find the quiet power in the room. That's who decides.

quiz.question: How can you identify the real decision-maker in a meeting?
options: Watch who others look at before speaking
They sit at the head of the table
